alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 11:17PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northern Cheyenne, northern Rawlins and northern Decatur Counties in northwestern Kansas, southern Red Willow, Hitchcock and Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 1145 PM MDT/1245 AM CDT/... At 1117 PM MDT/1217 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Lebanon to 9 miles southeast of Trenton to Haigler. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lebanon around 1225 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Herndon. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 228 and 256. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT/100 AM CDT/ for northeastern Colorado...northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
